location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.2122 of 1854 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is an acknowledgement of receipt of Kemball’s earlier letter (folio 349) relating to the eight slaves rescued at Bandar-e Moghūyeh. Anderson writes that the eight manumitted slaves have arrived in Bombay on the Honourable Company’s steamer Acbar, and have been handed over to the Senior Magistrate of Police.
